basics.name: Steve Perry
basics.label: Full Stack Web Developer
basics.summary: Web Development is a creative outlet for me. I enjoy finding my way to the solution almost as much as I do the solution itself. I'm a bit of a generalist, but I'm most comfortable implementing Front End UIs. My backend experience includes PHP (Laravel, Custom/Legacy) & Node (Sails.js, Serverless Functions)

work.summary: Work with Django developers or the QuickBase API to build UIs with either React or jQuery that encapsulate business processes that are not handled gracefully by enterprise ERP systems.
highlights: Implement Auth0 as a means of authentication to a widely used (thousands of active users) React App
Migrate legacy class based React App to functional components using hooks
Create & maintain private NPM package for shared UI components
Introduced Git & GitHub as a means of version control to the team (2016)
Created boilerplate git repos for frontend solutions that employ Webpack, Gulp, AWS CLI, Angular CLI
Created new UIs that more quickly and intuitively handle business processes like Inventory Maintenance and Order Fulfillment

work.summary: Develop custom solutions using RESTful APIs, PHP, HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
highlights: Created backend and frontend code bases that could be deployed from central location (using rsync) to 15 different servers/websites, while implementing site specific themes/variables and bringing order to what was previously disparate and ineffective forms of content management.
Used previously unused data to target current clients for upgrades.
Built out reporting tools that track sales, alert admin, and represent data visually.
Countless front-end development tweaks to increase conversion across the board

work.summary: Work within the Sails.js framework to bring RackFX’s solution to users.
highlights: Implement C.R.U.D. tasks using Sails’ Waterline ORM.
Use jQuery and Bootstrap3 for UI work.
Use Git and GitHub along with Waffle.io in an agile environment.

work.summary: Work within the Fat-Free PHP framework to resolve issues
highlights: Use jQuery, Bootstrap3, Mustache.js to display data on frontend.
Use Git and GitHub for version control.

work.summary: Instruct clients on how to leverage Eldorado’s web resources (Open API, StoreExtender.com, and Drop-Ship services)
highlights: Growth of gross monthly sales from an initial base of 10k to over 100k in 7 months

work.summary: Streamline client on-boarding with both technical and UI support.
highlights: Managed Featured Marketplace product listings using Word Press.
Completed training on ADTECH Helios IQ advertisement server.
